intro: Centaurium enclusense, commonly known as lesser centaury, is a flowering plant native to Europe, western Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows, woodlands, and along stream banks. It has slender, branching stems and lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. The flowers are tubular and attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies.
